dialogues.text: He's going to get something better than a job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An education. He finds a East City Community College Catalog 2006. Toss it to Larry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get some knowledge and you'll be fire proof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't there unemployed engineers and geophysicists?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to my husband. Hasn't called a man boss in years. Paid off the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won the Lottery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picked 8 little numbers when I kept saying he was a fool. A quarter million dollars later I've shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lost half to taxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see if there's a class in here for PowerBall 250. 22.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's half a buck for the book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They give these away free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They do. I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is alone. He is going to lose his house. He has nothin to do. He has no future. He sits on the couch. ESPN's SportsCenter is showing highlights...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's asleep on the couch. He awakens to the very same edition of ESPN's SportsCenter showing the very same highlights. Larry wants to shoot himself in the head. Instead, he pic up the catalog of East City College....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sign reads "Enroll Now! $15 per unit!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry parks in one of the hundreds of empty spaces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry is trying to make sense out of the application. An Enrollment Counsellor - DAVE BUSIK - sidles up to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to college, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First time. I was in the Navy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coast Guard. Adventure of a Lifetime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galley Mate. 23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We teach a whole track in Hotel and Restaurant Food Preparation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No, no. I need an all-new career and a place to go everyday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those two things are my specialty. HALLWAY -- walking towards Busik's cubicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First thing. Bravo for choosing East City College. Never too late for an education. Second, you need a jolt to the confidence machinery. He grabs a folder...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am going to change your life. (a page in the catalog)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speech 217: The Art of Informal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remarks, cause it's not enough to just be smart anymore, you have to project ease even when it ain't easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this Public Speaking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's training. Job interviews will be a breeze with the confidence you'll get from Speech Two One Seven. (even better...) And you'll spend three hours a week with the most attractive package in all of Academia. The Golden Girl of East City.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercedes Tainot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PROF. MERCEDES TAINOT is a fierce defender of literacy an intelligence -- and definitely one attractive package. headache/grogginess combo of Biblical proportions. 24.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please Enter your destination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here. Shut up. Turn off! Stepping from her sub-compact, she struggles into a pair heels, as in this state she drives barefoot. If only her huge Thermo-cup held a hair of the dog she might not walk such a crooked mile from the parking lot to the campus. Larry -- in his car -- screeches around a corner. He is frantically looking for a place to park, but as this is t first day of term, the lot is jammed! He nearly hits Mercedes Tainot.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES TAINOT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jerk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry! Parking's impossible today!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you new to the Faculty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New to the Student Body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the Faculty Lot. We've earned degrees for these spaces. Students park on Mars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to be late for my first day of school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet it won't be the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STUDENTS search for their new classrooms. Mercedes does t among these 'portable' classrooms that have not moved in years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercedes stops at the doorway. 25.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is it? P.O.V.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINE STUDENTS sit self-consciously, including PINEDO, DIBIASI, MACK, and CALIMERIS Mercedes quickly does a head count.
She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES TAINOT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My day has just been made and it's only 8:02 in the morning!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This class...is CANCELLED!! Mercedes explains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The city charter requires a minimum

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of ten students per class, otherwise it costs more to have us here than not. Did you really want a class at 8 AM? I didn't. Throw out those alarm clocks! Larry Crowne bursts through the door - panting for breath

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please tell me this is Speech 217. Mercedes drops her bag on her desk. She is crushed and ha Larry Crowne. She takes up some chalk, turns to the board, then writes large, shaky-yet-feminine script: CARE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She underlines it four times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While earning a Masters in Shakespearean Political Discourse from Vassar, I learned to care. Caring is a prerequisite for this class I have to teach in this

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES TAINOT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Participate. Show up on time. (Larry gets a eye on that) Care. And stay awake the 55 minutes three dawns a week I have to be here, or I will fail you and not care. (a name on the board) My name is Ms. Tainot. Not 'tie- knot'. Tay-no. You will each address the class on Wednesday. A procedure. How. To do. Something. Pinedo has panic in her eyes. Public speaking terr fies h Dibiasi raises his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Tie-knot? Ms. Tainot glares at Dibiasi. Glares and glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Tay-knot...Tai-bo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve Dibiasi. Friends call me Nomad. Only two days before I gotta get up and give my address? You may be dreaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you here, Steve?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Counsellor Busik said this class would change my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Busik. Of course... Dibiasi's cell phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta take this... Mercedes Tainot may kill this kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An actual classroom, but in sad shape. In one section sit LALA PINEDO - from the Speech Class. Larry sees her and sits next to her, oblivious to the fac that she is cripplingly shy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at us, in two classes in a row.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That Ms. Tainot is something else isn't she? I'm new to this coll ge life and, I confess, she sca es e This whole place scares me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I woke up this morning so nervous about the first day of school. I changed my clothes three times. We may have noticed TALIA FRANCESCO - a very stylish youn student - come in and sit nearby. No notebook or anything

dialogues.speaker: LARRY CROWNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Larry Crowne, and I'm babbling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am Lala.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MATSUTANI, (O.C.)
dialogues.text: I order you to turn off all cell phones, smart phones, and any phone- like devices! The teacher comes in - DR. MATSUTANI.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MATSUTANI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You have entered The Knowledge Zone!! Econ Prime! One textbook! (holding it up) Written by? Ed Matsutani, PhD. That's me! Read this book Follow into the Promised Land!

dialogues.speaker: DR. MATSUTANI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (he laughs mock

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That usually scares people. Yet none of you have fled. A good economic indicator. Larry leans over to Lala.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like this guy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Much like the other. Four students sit, waiting for class begin. Mercedes has already written up on the board in Happy Let

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "English 40: Shakespeare As Politician. CARE! PLEASE! I

dialogues.speaker: DO
dialogues.text: But no one else is showing up.

dialogues.text: The clock shows 3:09. MERCEDES TAINOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to the 16 sign-ups?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shakespeare as I know him... is cancelled.

dialogues.speaker: EXT GAS STATION
dialogues.text: Larry is filling up his car, watching his money go down h gas pipe. A body builder on a SCOOTER -- a guy we will come to know DELL GORDO -- pulls in to the opposite pump. He flips up seat, pops the pump into his scooter tank, and in seconds done. That scooter only sips gasoline. Off Dell goes, while Larry's tank fills and fills and fills...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry is walking from his house over to Lamarr's. 29.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lamarr, pipe in mouth, is forever arranging his goods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's cookin' Joe College?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Money woes. Paying for gas, getting to school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever come across a moped or a scooter for sale or trade? Lamarr stops in his tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patience is at her home office - card table. Coupons. Computer on eBay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your next wife might stand smoking that pipe in the house but your first one says 'uh-uh!' On the old TV on "Wheel of Fortune" (A person).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passing through, woman... Lamarr goes through the patio doors to the back yard, a s filled with even more yard sale items.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry Crowne, been thinking about you. Sit down here... Larry watches Vanna White turn letters - he solves the puzzle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "College Graduate."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's going to be you someday. She's pulled up some LP's on eBay on the computer. 30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have money in all those records. If you can part with them, they'd go for something on the eBay. I'll show you how... From the back patio, Lamarr comes in pushing a scooter in too bad of shape, though its windscreen is faded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This what you're talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a hunk of junk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is classic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will for eight hundred dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six fifty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six thirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gonna be a long night with you two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry! The secret of any negotiation is for both of us to win Talk to me How much do you 31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry is carrying his Flat Screen TV, wires, box and all, from his house to Lamarr's garage. "Wing Ding Ding!" goes the scooter Lamarr has been workin with his tools. He lets it idle as he takes the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful. I'll throw in a helmet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gas. Brake. Light's busted. Tires are low. You'll need a special license. Larry straps on the old, beat up crash helmet (DOT approv

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I need is the open road. Larry revs it, crashes into a hedge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You break it, you bought it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It still works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talking about the hedge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Images of an EROTIC SUPER-HEROINE -- busty and hot -- and others, are being studied, and saved one after another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEAN TAINOT is a self-published author and blogger -- wit taste for this kind of stuff. Multiple copies of his own books line the shelves. When he hears the FRONT DOOR open -- he panics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, hey! Who's home early! He keeps clicking away with the mouse until he's safe. Mercedes calls from the other room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He covers his digital tracks and hops out of his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercedes is prepping the Margaritas for cocktail hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First day of term calls for a celebration!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your burden this go round?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tap Dancing. Ping Pong. Water Torture. And Speech at Sunrise

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I built a Flamethrower of a posting for WarriorWeb which, if I do say, will feed nicely as an outline for

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the blender BLARES, husband and wife eye each other. S looking at him. He's smiling like a guilty idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Carrier: Second Angel." And, I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: was a guest blogger on CyberShare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blender off. She starts pouring.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN TAINOT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Y u don't believe me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why wouldn't I believe you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was composing, Mercy. That's what I do all day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were looking at porn. She takes a nice pull on that icy drink. Oh fine. Thought Police. I saw some erotica. I'm a man, I admit it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Took you a while. 33.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's barely porn. I'm not hiding it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you are. She bangs her head.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES TAINOT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Brain freeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't chug. Sip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone hides something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no secrets from you. I share the whole miserable slate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You walked in the door pissed off because -- I'm sorry -- I've

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: established a beach head in New

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Media while you still have to teach at Vassar of the Valley. You hide that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look at Bra-Busters Triple-X expecting me to pretend I don't know or I don't care. I do both and don't like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It may look like I don't work hard around here, Mercy. But I do. I'm just a guy who's a guy being a guy when you're not around... She walks away.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN TAINOT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And walking away is great for a relationship...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a tiny slab, but there is a tree and a fence and a 34.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercy closes the sliding door behind her and settles into chair and into her drink. This is where she goes when she thinks/drinks. Rap-rap-rap on the glass door. It's Dean, making one last point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a guy. Who's a guy. Being a guy... Mercy turns her face to the sky...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The streets are not yet crowded with traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MOTORCYCLE RIDER pilots a STATE OF THE ART STREET MACHI machine helmet, leather pants and jacket, radio in the helmet, saddlebags, windscreen. Probably a gynecologist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cyclist pulls up right next to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry Crowne, riding a scooter for the first time. Gives

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: passing Rider - who couldn't care less -- a 'thumbs up!'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speck-tack-alar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice machine. Where you headed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: School. College. I'm a student. What do you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a gynecologist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? I'd say 'have a great day' but that would be stating the 35.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light changes.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY CROWNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You take care. As the Rider takes off, Larry tries to do the same, but h stalls the engine. Cars honk horns at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry is trying to work the kick stand of his scooter. He not yet practiced at the thing. Another scooter rrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you get the Hot Wheels? Talia is shaking her hair free from her helmet. Larry fai to recognize her from Econ prime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That machine's a classic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got me here for a nickel's worth of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in Matsutani's Econ with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That class is straining my coconut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's only been one day

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't know you scooted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New to the sport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulls out mobile phone) Give me your number. I'll introduce you to like-minded enthusiasts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name please? 36.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry Crowne. With an 'e'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Larry'? I don't think so. I used to be Kathleen but one day I looked in the mirror and saw a girl named Talia. (then in her phone) Putting you in as 'Lance'. Check your texts and we'll do us some scooting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta tell you, Lance. Tucking a polo shirt into khakis makes you look like a cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not much fashion sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know! Gotta change that... Larry sees Mercedes Tainot walking from the Faculty lot, doesn't want to be late again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then get going!! Talia watches him go. Likes him thus far...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercedes is at a desk in the back. Bored and, yes, a bit hungover again. You can tell by the way she takes long pu from her Thermo-cup. Busik is sitting in on the class, not far from Mercedes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In front of the board that says "PHONES OFF!!" Calimeris demonstrating an exercise for her speech.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the push-up added, the 4-count Burpie becomes the 6-count Burpie and works out the pecs and biceps. It's an all-in-one exercise perfect for Cheerleader conditioning. The

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The class is too shy to applaud though Busik claps like a fan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We now all know how to Burpie. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's next? No one volunteers. Though Pinedo is about to...

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES TAINOT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Make me the bad guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Crowne?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Crowne. My bad. Larry goes to the podium - armed with a huge stack of 3x5

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Busik shoots him a 'thumbs up.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at Mercedes for the starting cue.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES TAINOT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My presentation will be on the subject of a very particular procedure. "How to make French Toast", but I'll speak English... Larry has used up one card. Mercedes rolls her eyes and t to herself in a MOVIE DEVICE way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M classes were once filled with e rnest young men ready to learn all I had to teach them. Cute boys fresh out of High School who all had crushes on me from day one. Now look at my cadre. Dibiasi. Bound for jail. Mack. Treating college like another tour of combat. Crowne. If this was Hamlet, he'd be Osric in Act 5. The part that is always cut. 38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry checks on Ms. Tainot in the back. She is not talkin only listening (the MOVIE DEVICE mentioned above)...

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES TAINOT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Busik, I am going to kill you. You can't suggest these saps take Shorthand or Oral Hygiene? Bring me in at this ungodly hour for 2 minutes on French toast? Busik looks at Mercedes, signals a 'not bad, eh?' about Larry. She is a stone face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most people think syrup comes out of a plastic bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still talking to herself) Great. The history of the sugar maple tree now. Thank you Wikipedia. Larry still has a dozen cards to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the speech is over. MERCEDES TAINOT (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah-ooo-gah! Time's up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That went fast...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breakfast may never be ready. Larry gathers his cards. Busik gives him a 'bravo!'

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES TAINOT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Next. Pinedo tries to volunteer to go next...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go. But you aren't going to like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you clairvoyant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding a pack of Toaster

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brown Waffles in toaster at lightest or lowest heat setting. An adult should supervise heating by children. Applause please. Mercedes rolls her head. Busik laughs out loud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simple. Direct. Informative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An incomprehensible POWERPOINT GRAPHIC is projected with M. explaining what it means. Gibberish!! Larry is taking notes, beside Lala, when his phone vibrat He flinches to turn it off before getting into trouble. On his phone a message: TALIA: "Scoot?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes a moment for him to understand what is going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His phone buzzes again. to your right" Larry looks as instructed. He sees Talia, phone in hand, miming riding a scooter -- you and me -- wind in our hair

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another text: TALIA: "Lance! Look Larry gets it. Nods okay. Turning back, he finds Dr. Matsutani, standing over him. Palm out.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MATSUTANI
dialogues.text: Your mobile, please. Larry hands it over.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MATSUTANI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I will return it after class if I don't crush it first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of the Scooter Gang have assembled as Larry and Tali walk up. DELL GORDO and STAN are talking about today's ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Monkey! Dell Gordo plants a kiss right on Talia's lips. She kisse him back. Larry sinks a little. 40.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It only figures Talia would have a boyfriend like Dell Go

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Lance Corona. Classmate and good guy, so far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dell Gordo. You want to ride with us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not. There is a beat of a stare down between Dell Gordo and La but then Dell starts to snap his fingers -- SNAP...SNAP...SNAP... -- the other join in until they are snapping fingers like the Jets vs. Sharks. Talia too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snap along, Lance or you can't join the gang. Larry, clumsily, starts snapping too. After a few bars...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. You're in for a trial run. And just like that, everyone goes back to their wheels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not many of these '66 Wasps left around. They had low torque. How's the torque? He means Larry's scooter.

dialogues.text: So? How about a demonstration? he means 'of the kitchen'. Larry's game...

dialogues.text: That Denise. What a fool. You a e way cooler than you appear. She leaves. Dell Gordo lingers.

dialogues.text: Lance. All men fall in love with

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Even business can break down into a Shakespearean Five-Act Structure!

dialogues.text: FRANCES TAYLOR-BRIEGH is a former student of Mercedes wit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: braces on her teeth. Her name is printed in perfect block letters behind her on the board. She is giving a polished well-prepared "off the cuff" presentation: DYNAMIC SEMINA PRESENTS: SHAKESPEAREAN ECONOMICS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Act I: Inventory. What do you sell? Act Two? To Market. Reach your buyers. Act Three? Three legs of accounting. Receivable. Payable. Due. Act Four? Forward planning. Plan to grow. Act Five? Final Profitability. What do you clear on bottom-line?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In other words: "To be or not to be... in Business." It's all nonsense, but it looks nice in PowerPoint form.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry is taking notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calimeris has drawn her Pyramid of ideas. Mack sleeps with his head straight up. 49.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinedo is listening intently, counting the ideas out on h hands. Dibiasi is doodling drawings of football players.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCES TAYLOR-BRIEGH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: For business, social, and self- improvement workshops, email me: Francestaylor-briegh@dynasem.com. Mercedes Tainot is in the back -- her mind far from her classroom. She is preoccupied. The applause for the speaker jolts her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you notice? No script. No notes. So it can be done. The class breaks up. Pinedo makes it a point to pick up s DynaSem brochures. Larry remains, scribbling notes.

dialogues.text: White, Siler and Koss, you are up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: next time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did good, Fran. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything for the woman who brought out the public speaker in Frances Taylor-Briegh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used you as a Focal Reference but you weren't there for me. What's wrong, Mercy? Mercedes signals Frances: "Not yet", then points to Larry still finishing up his notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I broke up with the Orthodontist. Now I have to get a new boyfriend and a new orthodontist. You ever do that? Get crushes on people you see every day after ignoring them and then find out they're creeps after all?

dialogues.text: Mr Crowne? Can you move along 50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a great presentation. I learned a lot from it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Super.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smart stuff. Super smart. The women watch him go. As soon as he's out the door:

dialogues.text: Mercy. You're an idol to me. Hearing you talk like that is

dialogues.text: crushing my dreams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I'm joking of course!!! She pretends to laugh. A little too much.

dialogues.text: If the balance on Axis A is the same metric as Axis B you're in deficits because of overhead, taxes, and re-investment.

dialogues.text: Someone's been reading my book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Break Even Paradox creates a new metric... Talia makes a decision and palms her phone, punching in a text. In a second, Larry's phone vibrates. He struggles t get it before he gets caught with his mobile on. TALIA: "Scoot? You/me?"

dialogues.text: Larry nods at Talia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Palm out again. DR. MATSUTANI (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry and Talia. Scooting along like Elvis and Ann-Margre in Viva Las Vegas.

dialogues.text: He dangles her a fresh Margarita. She'll take it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercedes and Dean have had make up sex. It was okay.

dialogues.text: Ah. That was nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was. Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been thinking. If you ever want to take a whack at writing something -- say a blog a couple of times a week -- I could help you out.

dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd read your stuff. Make comments to make it web-savvy. Pieces need

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: to pop, you know. Takes a little

dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN TAINOT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm just a guy who's a guy being a guy... Mercedes' eyes: She didn't like hearing that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry -- in new, vintage clothes with his morning coffee is at his computer entering his financial record into a program - Ed Matsutani's SmartPlanning MoneyWorks. He is also on his Mobile Phone -- pressing his party's extension... 55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Denise. How can I help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denise. Larry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My god. Larry Crowne. I remember you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This a good time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other than me being at work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm surprised is all. What do you want? With checkbooks, statements, etc. Larry is looking for th bottom line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. Okay. Uh. Here's the deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spit it, Lar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to miss a few months on the checks for the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hoped not to, but I there it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. 56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many months?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's start with six. Silence on the other end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That can't happen, Larry. I'm extended. I've put a deposit down on the first vacation I've had in 5 1/2 years. My expenses are as valid as yours, so I need the checks like always. A deal's a deal. He goes back to the computer, to eBay to see how his LP auction is going. One record is going for... $0.75. Another: $1.25. Another NO BIDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not my problem. Take out a loan on the house or something.

dialogues.text: I tried. I'm too much of a risk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm not touching that. I don't want to open up the whole lawyer thing, but I will if pushed. Sucks, doesn't it? I appreciate the rigorous Crowne honesty, but this can't happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These calls are monitored to guarantee customer satisfaction, so I'm hanging up before my supervisor comes on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establish. It's early. Few customers 57.

dialogues.text: Can I smell trouble or what?

dialogues.text: Those two over in booth 6... P.O.V.: Two GUYS IN SUITS.

dialogues.text: Homeland Security. I piped thei badges and everything.

dialogues.text: What is Homeland Security doing here... Raul looks back in the kitchen. Carlos and Nick are prepp their stations. Raul bolts for the kitchen. In seconds we can see him thr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the Service Window. He whispers and gestures to Carlos and Nick, who suddenly show PANIC in their eyes. They now bolt the kitchen, out the back way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perry is po ring coffee for the Agents, making small talk as... Out side the window, Carlos and Nick are fleeing for thei Illegal Alien lives...

dialogues.text: Larry is still trying to makes sense of his money woes wh his phone rings... Caller ID: "Perry's Coffee Shop Breakfast All Day!"

dialogues.text: This is Larry Crowne?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raul? Yes.

dialogues.text: I do?

dialogues.text: The place has filled with customers. Perry is jammed and behind the window, Raul is slapping orders up in a frenzy

dialogues.text: We're swamped, Kimosabe. Get back there!

dialogues.text: You're late on your first day!

dialogues.text: Larry comes through the swinging doors. He stops and take breath. His life has come to this. He is back in a kitche What can he do, but dive in...

dialogues.text: Larry is at the window, putting up orders and ripping sli off the wheel. Not so much as cracking a smile, though...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you learn to turn eggs like 59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The USS Coral Sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boss, I don't want to quit school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta get to class before I miss the whole day. And I can't work mornings Mondays, Wednesdays, Fridays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon as the rush is finished, go. I'll get my idiot brother-in-law three days a week. You take evenings. Deal?

dialogues.text: Deal. When will we talk salary?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never. This is take it or leave

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: it. Don t worry. I may be tough but I'll be fair.

dialogues.text: Mack is at the podium giving a presentation with his Star Wars Action figures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are not toys. Nobody 'plays' with these. These are kept behind glass, so no way am I passing them around today. Mercedes TALKS to us and HERSELF.

dialogues.text: Wait a ding dong minute. (counts the heads) 1.2.3.4.5.6.7.8.9. Someone is missing! Who cut my class? She lets slip OUT LOUD:

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES TAINOT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where's Larry Crowne?! Everyone looks at her. 60.

dialogues.text: Guess Larry's out today.

dialogues.text: Anyone know why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't call me. Ad-libs: no one knows why Larry is out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe this! Ditching me? He ditched me? Not okay. Larry Crowne, you are on my Shit List. Everyone shares looks like they've witnessed a Lover's Sp Speaking quietly in their seats...

dialogues.text: Sounds like Teacher has a thing for a Teach-ee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you were out last week, she said nothing. I think she has a crush on Larry Crowne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do too. (off their looks) He's a nice man. Mack speaks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should I continue?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Tell us more about your man dolls. Mack is humiliated now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure everyone recognizes Boba Fett...

dialogues.text: Dr. Matsutani is in mid-lecture when Larry comes in, late

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: W ere's my purse? Oh yeah. My car. The key please? It's buried in that plant. Larry digs out an Altoids tin. Rattles it.

dialogues.text: When I say 'what', it means I get it and have already purposefully forgotten everything. Call it irony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: My helmet?

dialogues.text: Thanks. He gently removes the strap and helmet from her head. be a bit sexy. Her hair tumbles out.

dialogues.text: You want to make out with me, you can. I know I'm not a third rate Audrey Hepburn wanna-be but I still

dialogues.text: My spouse won't be home for 3 to 5 years. Larry ponders this moment for as long as he can. He shouldn't, of course. But, damn. She is Mercedes Tainot. Bang.

Still wanting to 'bump' into the man who kissed her last night, she circumvents his path, stalking Larry like a birdwatcher tracks a blue-tailed swallow. Hopping behind a tree, Mercy's SHOE gets caught in some m Bending down, a branch catches her sweater and RIPS a sea Stepping onto the pavement, the tree branch SMACKS her in head. Still, she keeps and eye on Larry. And pursues...

dialogues.text: a time span.

dialogues.text: I wouldn't want that.

dialogues.text: happened before.

dialogues.text: I'm not saying that. 95.

But I am never once going to look at myself as another poor divorced guy who could still be married if only he had done the mea culpa bit for all his faults.

dialogues.text: Take it up with her. Larry heads out of the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shouting, okay? This is a family friendly establishment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here comes Larry, not yet seeing Mercedes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frances Taylor-Briegh. You have a problem with your order?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knock Larry over with a feather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Tainot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The student of yours!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Larry Crowne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no way in creation I screw up French Toast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was fine, actually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to see if it was really you cooking back there. And say, howdy. Howdy doody. During the following, Frances is trying to get a whiff of Larry -- to find out how he smells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready for the final?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be the judge of that. The is a beat of silence.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY CROWNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So, your meal is satisfactory?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you let my boss know so I don't lose this job?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes indeed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall I prepare you another batch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Thanks. 103.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I will return to my station.. Mercedes watches him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You kissed the cook...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a whiff. He smelled like bell pepper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at the men in my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blame it on the booze... and collect yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hoor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my problem. I'm a drunken hoor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That ends... right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry comes back through the door, humiliation wracking h face. He tosses the French Toast down the disposal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercedes and Frances are ATTACKING the house with vacuums cleaners, and fortitude. BOOKS on Shakespeare and Shaw go on shelves where Dean's tomes used to rest. Computer wires are not even untangled just chucked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cupboard is open. Where there was once booze go coffe and teas. MUSIC is playing as these girlfriends reconstruct Mercy's life... 104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The street is empty. Larry is on his scooter, riding arou and around and around the block that he will soon leave. He can see his NEIGHBORS through the open windows -- KIDS bouncing on a couch...A QUARTET OF OLD FOLKS playing card and laughing... a MOVIE playing on a big TV. This was Larry's street...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercedes exits the door, crisp, clean -- like we've never seen her in the mornings. See the way she holds, not clutches, her Thermo-Cup?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's wearing a zipped up jacket. Kids and dog-walkers pas as his scooter starts pronto, he is off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FOR SALE sign on his lawn has an addition: IN ESCROW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the projected computer screen: A portrait of DISRAELI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dibiasi is giving his speech, but we are hearing Mercedes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a difference from day one. I must be a better teacher than I thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dibiasi is nailing it. Calimeris stopped up-talking. Lala you can't shut up. Mack spoke about Australia for three minutes and mentioned kangaroos only twice. And Larry Crowne... Larry is listening to Dibiasi, wearing what was once his UniMart polo, with his nametag and everything. Compared t the man he is now, that polo looks out of place.. 105.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES TAINOT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I was tough on him. But he learned fast. How he connected the Circle of Sales to the expanding universe is impressive as hell. I'll never forget about the Value Index now. He gave a perfect speech.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And... He's polite. Instead of fighting me off that night, what does he do but kisses me one and then all but tucks me in. What kind of guy does that to a loopy tramp like me? He could have ravaged me. I misread this guy and if I had a brain I'd find a way to steal him away from that cutie pie and keep him for myself. I wonder if he'd like that, if he would... What did I just say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I just say about Larry Crowne? The class has stopped. It seems that Mercedes just said t last bit out loud and everyone heard it. The women eye ea other. The men stifle laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. And I was just wrapping up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry. Please go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry? It okay if I get to my climax and denouement? Larry nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you... If it was the romance novelist in him that made Victoria the Queen become such a pal, chalk it up as another brick in the legacy of Ben Disraeli -- Earl of Beaconsfield - Educator - and Prime Minister of Great Britain. Not bad for a Jewish guy, huh? Dibiasi is done. Applause. 106.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not so much as a bump, Nomad! Why'd you go last?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fourth quarter dramatics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that it mattered to my Speech professor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations all of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's the MVP, Mrs. Tainot? Can we vote?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not me, I have to stay objective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say... Lala! They all say Lala! It's unanimous! They start chanting he name. "La la! La la! La la!" -- embarrassing her. Larry sits her down in her chair and gets the other guys pick her up like she's the bride at a wedding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a spontaneous party that Mercedes has to back out of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she leaves, she looks back long enough to see Larry Cr leading a parade around the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is taking the final.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Matsutani. Looking around the class. Using his hands like a pair of binoculars. Lala is using a thesaurus and dictionary to polish answer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry is finished. He walks up to Dr. M. and hands in his Blue Book.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MATSUTANI
dialogues.text: The first to finish. No surprise. Dr. Matsutani hands Larry his confiscated phone. Larry leaves. 107.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The final utensils are going into a box. Larry is doing t part himself. He sits for a moment -- in the breakfast nook -- surveyin his kitchen, what was once his. Mack comes in with a box of his LP's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the last of them. Damn, you have a lot of records.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Priceless at a buck apiece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His furnishings are out on the lawn. Lamarr and Patience looking them over. Mack and Dibiasi are putting the last his things into Mack's huge SUV and Larry's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A two-bedroom apartment and you don't have room for your furniture?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selling this futon-sofabed? All those years across the street and you've learned nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the minimum you'll take for this stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll get me top price.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did learn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pizza at last!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's lunch as promised! The BIG STORK PIZZA GUY pulls up in a different car but t same sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a cock. Larry Crowne. The Pizza guy is none other than Jack Strang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack Strang. Wow. This is irony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two extra large. One Salad Bucket. Box of Frosty Cinnamon Eggs. Sixteen- fifty. Larry hands him the coupon and a Twenty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack. I need two bucks back. Times are tough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. Forget it. Keep the change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strang leaves. Larry watches him go. him. It almost was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate it. That could have been

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raul and Perry are talking when they see Mercedes Tainot enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My next wife just walked in. Perry looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love this business sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something told me you'd be back. Is Larry Crowne working today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry is arranging his station. 109.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry, your Speech 217 teacher has a question about the menu. Larry can see her. She looks gorgeous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead. I'll take the window even though I'm the boss of the whole kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercedes is having coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's Larry Crowne. Are you allowed to sit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where does Perry get his coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I add chicory and a bit of vanilla. Trick I picked up in the Navy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're probably wondering why I stopped by. Well, it's to tell you your grade for Speech 217. You killed on the final and have an A. Way to go! She offers him a Terrorist Fist Bump. With the hand that longer has a wedding ring on it...

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES TAINOT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Actually, everybody got an A, but you got the special A where I tell you in person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't expect that. Thanks, Mrs. Tainot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Class is out. Call me Mercedes. Or Mercy, for short.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. Just wanted to congratulate you. Your girlfriend will be thrilled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I meant the... never mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which classes are you going to ace next term?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This has turned into a full time gig. Out of necessity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you continue your education. Back at East City. You've made such a good start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got Speech 217 moved to 10 AM, thank God. Who knows what I'll hear with the extra sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My first class in college ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I get an A. Gotta be the teacher. They look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should get going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know anything about car devices, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cars not much. Devices some. They rise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercy is opening her door, starting her car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please enter your destination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh be quiet. That's a MapGenie. 111.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is Hellspawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my old job, I'd have steered you to a Vortex unit. The MapGenie interface is clumsy and the menu needs too many inputs. He is reaching into the car, across her to tap the unit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was working fine. Then I think I pressed too many buttons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. The Auto On Feature is engaged. Menu. Select. Features. Auto Voice. Select. Change? Yes. On. Off. Done? Yes. Save. Back. Back. Back. Exit. While he was doing that, Mercedes was smelling what she c of Larry. She liked it. She looked at his neck, his ears. And smelled him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long was this broken?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seemed like years and years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All better now. Should be able to find your way. Nothing to do now but say goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hear a pounding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raul is at the window inside the cafe, signaling the brea over.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY CROWNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My Boss. Back to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the good news...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perry greets him at the door. 112.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimosabe, holding off til after school to woo the teacher is the move of a class act. Larry turns to watch Mercedes drive away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sign says "New Term Beginning! $20 a unit! Ask about Financial Aid!" Did you notice? The cost of an education just went up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercedes has just written "Care" next to "Welcome to Shakespeare!!" up on the board. She turns. And does a qui head count. Only 6 students are enrolled. She's going to lose this on again. Clumps up the wooden steps are heard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calimeris, Mack, Pinedo, and Dibiasi come tramping in. Tw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: students now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on his phone) I gotta get off, Baby, or I'm in hot water with Professor Tai-bo... Mercy does a Shakespearean dance of joy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Larry with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, no. Should we track him down and drag him in here? Mercedes does her best to hide her disappointment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... Seeing you all... I just thought...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Choose a seat and lets get started! The four smile at each other... 113.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrying a torch for Larry til it burns her hands...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercedes is walking to another building, another class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She may not realize it, but she is looking for Larry Crow Busik is busy chatting her up. Seriously chatting her up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the excitement of first day of term, I don't want to go back to my empty apartment. Do you? I need a drink and some talk and some wind- down time. Don't you?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MATSUTANI, (O.C.)
dialogues.text: Ms. Tainot? She turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. M.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MATSUTANI
dialogues.text: Larry Crowne is taking six units from me, devouring the material like a starving man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry's enrolled?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MATSUTANI
dialogues.text: He's continuing his education and tells me it is because of you. That your class changed his life. Mercedes finds herself smiling -- beaming...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry said that about me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah! I put that guy in your class. So technically, I changed his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is a good student 114.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MATSUTANI
dialogues.text: And handy on a scooter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there any chance you would consider having drinks with an older faculty peer who holds a PhD in Economics?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, no. No offense Dr. M.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MATSUTANI
dialogues.text: The rumor is you are newly single and I was just taking a shot. Mercy looks right at Busik.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: News travels fast. Busik pretends he knows nothing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're going out, I'm not doing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: anything.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MATSUTANI
dialogues.text: Have you ever been to Hooters?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the spicy wings, yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a note on Mercy's car. She takes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "To test your MapGenie: 4225 Harbor Blvd. 2nd floor. An ' student." Her breath catches in her heart...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercedes is driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right Turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it Turning right 115.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your destination is ahead on the right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is? That was a breeze. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open for business with bunting and everything. Talia is eating take out sushi and reading the soy sauce packet. S is tying to check out her ass-crack tattoo to see if it really does say 'Soy Sauce'. Mercedes has arrived. Talia sees her and comes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lamarr is around. Patience, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We might notice that Dell Gordo and Larry now dress exact alike, as we've seen the same jacket once on Lance Corona

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love that blouse with that skirt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: but I'd show more leg if I were you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Mercy Tainot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bambi Romp in the Glen. Looking for Lance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4225 Harbor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is 4227.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4225. You'll see the stairs. The tattoo parlor. Larry's scooter is right in front. As goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little higher heels'll get you wolf whistles. 116.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music is playing. A nice view is revealed as Mercy arrive a nice little porch. On a little table sits a potted plan In the potted plant is an Altoids tin. Mercy gives it a rattle. In the tin, a brand new key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercy takes the key. Slides it into the lock and slowly opens the door. The music gets louder. She can't see much into the tiny flat, but she can make out... Larry, arranging the last of his stuff. Mercy stands at the door until he sees her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he does, he says nothing. But steps to her and smell her - her neck, her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you tell Ed Matsutani taking my class changed your life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I met you. That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss. Damn fine whammy kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No larger than the nook of his old house. Breakfast is be served. The most beautiful woman ever to wear a bathrobe has made French Toast and is settling into the Breakfast Nook. Larry Crowne has his hair all on one side of his head -- Afternoon-Of-Amok-Loving. His arm shows a Navy tattoo tha may be old or new... Mercy Tainot glows in and out. She slides next to him, cl to him The meal is perfect 117.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercy is still in her robe, riding on Larry's scooter, ba and forth in front of the Parlor and Talia's store. Larry is having coffee, sitting on the steps, watching he ride back and forth. She is getting good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talia and the gang spill out of the store to watch her. Hoots and laughter. Larry uses his robe as a matador's cape, Mercy as the bul As she passes under his flaring cape...
